description: Application for a Minor Material Amendment (S73a) to vary condition 2 (approved plans) of planning permission ref: 172223FUL dated 14/12/2017 for: Construction of a two storey plus basement dwelling to the rear of the 2 Denmark Road fronting on to St Leonards Road; with amenity space and cycle storage and waste storage. Amendment seeks external changes to elevations and internal layout modification throughout basement and basement access; ground floor; first floor and roof alterations
decision_conditions: The development to which this permission relates shall be begun not later than the expiration of three years from the 14 December 2017.
Reason: To comply with Section 91 of the Town & Country Planning Act 1990.

| The development hereby approved shall be in accordance with drawing title numbers and approved documents: PD001(proposed plans); PD002 revision 01 (proposed elevation & section A); 02L211-ID001 - Variation statement dated 05/11/2020
Reason: For the avoidance of doubt, and in the interests of proper planning
| All external materials to be used in the development shall match those set out in the submitted Variation Statement, 02L211-ID001 unless indicated on the approved plans or application form.

Reason: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings, in accordance with policies 1.1 & 1.2 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies 7.4 & 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies 7.4 & 7.6 of the London Plan (2016); Draft New London Plan(2019) policies D1 and D4 and the National Planning Policy Framework (2019).
| The proposed rooflights hereby approved shall not project more than 150mm from the roof plane and shall be retained as such for the lifetime of the development

Reason: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings, in accordance with policies 1.1 & 1.2 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies 7.4 & 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies 7.4 & 7.6 of the London Plan (2016); Draft New London Plan(2019) policies D1 and D4 and the National Planning Policy Framework (2019).

| Notwithstanding the provisions of Article 3 of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) (England) Order 2015 (or any subsequent amendment, revision or new Order) no windows or other openings (other than those shown on the submitted plans) shall be formed in the walls or roof of the building permitted.

Reason:  To protect residential amenity, in accordance with policies 1.1 & 1.2 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies 7.4, 7B and 7C of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies 7.4 & 7.6 of the London Plan (2016); policies D1 and D4 of the Draft New London Plan(2019), and the National Planning Policy Framework (2019).

| The Construction Logistics Plan approved under consent 194818CND shall be implemented on commencement of any works on site and the site shall be managed in accordance with the approved plan for the duration of the site preparation and construction.

Reason: In the interests of the amenity of adjoining occupiers and to minimise highway and traffic impact during the course of the works, in accordance with policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management Plan (2013), policy 1.1(j) of the Ealing Development (Core) Strategy (2012)

| The car parking layout approved under consent 194820CND shall be implemented in full. The spaces shall be marked out on the site prior to first occupation and be kept continuously available for car parking, and shall not be used for any other purpose

Reason: In the interests of highway/pedestrian safety and an appropriate operation of the development in accordance with policies 1.1â‚¬ of the Ealing Core Strategy(2012), policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management DPD(2013), policies 6.13 of the London Plan(2016) and Draft New London Plan(2019) policy T6.1.

| The development hereby approved shall not be occupied until refuse and recycling storage within an enclosure has been provided within the front garden of the property, in accordance with the Local Planning Authority Standards and has been fully implemented and made available for use. These facilities shall thereafter be retained for use at all times.

Reason: To ensure the provision of satisfactory facilities for the storage of refuse and recycling material, in accordance with policies 1.1 and 1.2 of the Adopted Ealing Development (Core) Strategy (2012) policy 7B of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013) and policies 7.4, and 7.6 of the London Plan (2016).

| Notwithstanding the provisions of Classes A, B, C, D and E of Part 1 of Schedule 2 to the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) Order 1995 (as amended), no extensions or works as specified in the stated classed shall be carried out without the prior permission of the Local Planning Authority, obtained through the submission of a planning application.

Reason: To prevent the overdevelopment of the site and to safeguard the living conditions of adjoining properties and visual appearance of the building in accordance with policies 7.4 and 7.6 of the London Plan(2016), Policy D4 of the Draft New London Plan (2019) and Ealing's Development Management DPD(2013) policies 7.4 and 7B.
| At least three (3) secure cycle parking spaces shall be provided on site and retained thereafter
Reason: to encourage sustainable transport modes in accordance with London Plan (2016) policy 6.9 and table 6.3 and Draft New London Plan(2019)-intend to publish policy T5 and table 10.2
